To date,{{when|date=October 2011}} roughly 150 protestors remain camped at City Hall Park.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://occupydallas.org/occupydallas-ga-votes-47-21-move-city-hall-park |title=OccupyDallas GA votes 47-21 to move to City Hall Park |publisher=Occupy Dallas |date=2011-10-14 |accessdate=2011-10-20}}</ref> Originally camped at [[Pioneer Plaza]], protestors agreed to move to City Hall Park as a settlement with the city of [[Dallas]].<ref>{{cite web|author=North Texas |url=http://www.publicbroadcasting.net/kera/news.newsmain/article/0/0/1863480/North.Texas/City.Offers.New.Location.To.Occupy.Dallas |title=KERA: City Offers New Location To Occupy Dallas (2011-10-13) |publisher=Publicbroadcasting.net |date=2011-10-13 |accessdate=2011-10-20}}</ref>
To date,{{when|date=October 2011}} roughly 150 protestors remain camped at City Hall Park.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://occupydallas.org/occupydallas-ga-votes-47-21-move-city-hall-park |title=OccupyDallas GA votes 47-21 to move to City Hall Park |publisher=Occupy Dallas |date=2011-10-14 |accessdate=2011-10-20}}</ref> Originally camped at [[Pioneer Plaza]], protestors agreed to move to City Hall Park as a settlement with the city of [[Dallas]].<ref>{{cite web|author=North Texas |url=http://www.publicbroadcasting.net/kera/news.newsmain/article/0/0/1863480/North.Texas/City.Offers.New.Location.To.Occupy.Dallas |title=KERA: City Offers New Location To Occupy Dallas (2011-10-13) |publisher=Publicbroadcasting.net |date=2011-10-13 |accessdate=2011-10-20}}</ref>
  +   +   +
==Stephen Benavides arrest==
  +
On November 5, protestors from Occupy Dallas assembled outside of a Dallas [[Bank of America]]. Dallas Police Officer Jimmy Hollis, working as a security guard at the time, alleged that protestor Stephen Benavides had assaulted him. Benavides was arrested, and charged with assaulting a public servant and resisting arrest.<ref>Carlos Miller - [http://www.pixiq.com/article/youtube-video-exposes-dallas-cop-to-be-a-liar "Youtube Video Exposes Dallas Cop to be a Liar"]</ref> Benavides was imprison for four days, after which he was released on a $50,000 bond.
  +   +
Subsequent video emerged, however, that appeared to contradict police claims. On the video, Officer Hollis is shown pushing a Benavides off of a 4-ft-tall planter, sending him tumbling down onto the pavement. <ref>NBC-DFW [http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/45262796/ns/local_news-dallas_fort_worth_tx/#.Tr8QfLKMh8E "Occupy" Video Sparks DPD Probe ]</ref>
